feed.subtitle: A really swell blog built with Webby

entry.title: Introduction to Lua
entry.content:
Lua is a fast, lightweight, simple programming language designed to be easy to extend and to easy to be used to extend programs written in other languages.

    print "hello world"

Litora Sociis

entry.title: Building This Site With Webby
entry.content:
So I hear these things called “blogs” are the next big thing and being the early adopter I am I figure I better have one.

Choosing a Platform

All I need is a basic site where I can put a little information about myself and write an article once in awhile. I’m a developer so I must be able to hack on it.

Introducing Webby

sudo gem install webby

I’m a Developer, I need to write about Source Code

Introducing Ultraviolet:“http://ultraviolet.rubyforge.org”

What About Comments?

The answer is Disqus. Adding comments is as easy as copy and pasting a little html from Disqus’s site.

<div id="disqus_thread"></div>
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://disqus.com/forums/username/embed.js"></script>
<noscript><a href="http://username.disqus.com/?url=ref">View the discussion thread.</a></noscript>

Resources

I’m not the only person using webby, the following links proved helpful when building this site
  • Of course Webby’s Homepage and rdoc
  • Magnus Holm has a post about using webby
  • Rein Henrichs is using webby and his source is also available at github
  • Mike Clark wrote a nice article about using webby
  • Disqus
